weatherForecast.comment: Eastbound of Hochschwab cloudy skies on Sunday morning are forecasted. The skies are clearing up from the west. Sunday will be in general a sunny day with little influence of Sahara dust. In the evening clouds are coming from southwest. Strong southern winds. Temperatures will be around 3 degrees in 2.000 m at noon.

avalancheActivity.highlights: In high altitudes danger spots are found in some places
avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanche danger is in general low. In high altitudes danger spots in form of snowdrift deposits which are prone to triggering are found. There - in shady areas or adjacent to ridgelines small slab avalanches can be triggered. In extremely steep slopes on sunny areas spontaneous loose-snow avalanches can’t be ruled out. Ridgelines and summits are icy and hard. Be aware of risk of falling.

snowpackStructure.comment: During the night the snow cover cools down and solidifies. Due to radiation the snow will get firn-like already in the morning and gets increasingly moist and instable. On shady slopes above 2.000 m loose snow is found in some places, and in rare cases thin snowdrift deposits which are prone to triggering have formed. The snow base is predominantly stable. Especially on sunny slopes only little amounts of snow is found even in high altitudes.

tendency.highlights: Monday morning dense clouds and rain up to 2.000 m is forecasted. In the afternoon it will clear up and sunny for the east is called. In the west low altitude clouds can persist. The avalanche danger will stay low.

customData.generalHeadline: Increasingly cloudy skies, mild temperatures and strong southern winds
